title: Petrified Forest National Park: Guest Speakers
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Parks as Classrooms     Guest Speakers                Guest Speakers        Amanda shares ranger duties in the classroom. NPS       Classroom Visits If you are not able to make it to Petrified Forest National Park and live within 100 miles of the park, we may be able to arrange for a park ranger to visit your classroom. Here are some examples of possible classroom programs, although we can always try to cater to your specific education needs. · Conducting lessons taken from the Rockin' Through the Ages education manual. · Discussion of petrified wood and fossil formation with hands on examples of Triassic Period fossils from the park. Why are National Parks important and what can we do to help protect them?  Ecology of Petrified Forest National Park - what is the environment and what plants and animals live there
